isis.stitle: CAB: DAYCAB AND SLEEPER CAB for ProStar, ProStar Premium, and ProStar Limited Models - REMOVE - OUTER CAB DOOR HANDLE

svcsubproc.title: Remove Cab Door Outer Cab Door Handle on Daycab and Sleeper Cab

step1.para:
Remove cab door trim panel, refer to
CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL
. If cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
. If cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door vapor barrier, refer to
CAB DOOR VAPOR BARRIER
. If cab door is equipped with electric door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Electric Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab
. If cab door is equipped with manual door window and locks, refer to Remove Cab Door Vapor Barrier with Manual Door Window and Locks on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

Remove cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to
MODULAR DOOR HARDWARE ASSEMBLY
. For removing cab door modular door hardware assembly, refer to Remove Cab Door Modular Door Hardware Assembly on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 55 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

note.para: Modular Door Hardware Assembly is viewed from the back in Figure 56.

step1.para:
With cab door modular door hardware assembly (Item 1, Figure 46)
removed and placed on a suitable work surface. Remove outer cab door handle (Item 1) from window run channel (Item 2) by pressing the locking tab (Item 3) in and slide hanger support bracket (Item 4) out of window run channel, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 55. Outer Cab Door Handle, Rear Window Run Channel and Hanger Support Bracket

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 56 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Slide control rod (Item 1) coming from outer cab door handle (Item 2) out of lock lever (Item 3) of cab door latch (Item 4), driver side shown.

Rotate outer cab door handle (Item 2) and slide it off control rod (Item 5) coming from cab door latch (Item 4), driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 56. Outer Cab Door Handle and Control Rods

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 57 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If it is necessary to replace outer cab door handle (Item 1), rotate hanger support bracket (Item 2) counter clockwise, lining up slot (Item 3) in hanger support bracket with T-shaped locking tab (item 4) on outer cab door handle and lift it off, driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 57. Outer Cab Door Handle and Hanger Support Bracket

step1.para:
Remove cab door lock cylinder, refer to
CAB DOOR LOCK CYLINDER
. For removing cab door lock cylinder, refer to Remove Cab Door Lock Cylinder on Daycab and Sleeper Cab.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove door lock control rod (Item 1) from door lock cylinder lever (Item 2) on outer cab door handle (Item 3), driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.
Remove door lock cylinder lever (Item 2) from outer cab door handle (Item 3), driver side shown. Lay it out of the way and save for installation, unless damaged and being replaced.

figure.caption: Figure 58. Outer Cab Door Handle and Door Lock Control Rod

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side outer cab door handle.
